translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter about the Giver of Alms
The Elder Āsanupaṭṭhāhaka
Having gone to the forest, the grove,
the quiet, secluded place,
I gave a lion throne
to the one who sees the benefit, the one who is content.

analyzed: mālāhattham gahetvāna  katvā ca nam padakkhiṇa
translated: Having taken a garland in my hand,🔽and having circumambulated him,
having worshipped the Teacher,
I departed facing north.
Because of that deed, O Leader of Men,
the best in the world, the bull of a man,
I attained Complete Emancipation,
all my existences have been destroyed.
For one hundred and eighteen eons,
the gift I gave then,
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of the lion throne.
For seven hundred eons from now,
the one who will attain Complete Emancipation will be a noble,
endowed with the seven treasures,
a powerful Universal Monarch.
The four analytical insights,
I have done what the Buddha asked.”🔽Thus the elder Āsanupaṭṭhāhaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā āsanupaṭṭhāhako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Āsanupaṭṭhāhakattherassāpadānaṁ aṭṭhamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai āsanupaṭṭhāhakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽āsanupaṭṭhāhaka therassa apadānam aṭṭhama
translated: The Elder Āsanupaṭṭhāhaka’s Birth Story is the eighth.
